result.execSummary:
The defendant Roy C Viveros was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Battery [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 940.19(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 12/18/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-36

miscConds.notes: Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges,including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered from CASH BAIL ON DEPOSIT; remainder to be paid during period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued. Pay supervision fees.
- No co9ntact with firearms. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

- Complete Batterer's Intervention program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Obtain/maintain employment.

timeConds.notes: 40 days STAYED pending review. The remaining 20 days are to be served now, Huber release for work. Defendant has until 10-15-15 to report in.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Roy C Viveros

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Roy C Viveros in court.  Margaret Anne Kunisch appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
  DOC agent also in court.
Based upon the defendant's compliance with the conditions of probation, the Court ordered that time in the House of Correction, which was ordered as a condition of probation but stayed to today's date, be stayed for use at the agent's discretion in the future.

Defendant Roy C Viveros in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Elizabeth Longo appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Defendant is going to change his plea.
As to count 1:
Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, plead GUILTY and was examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis for the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen deportation is possible.  Court found defendant guilty as charged in the Criminal Complaint and ordered entry of Judgment of Conviction.
As to count 2:
On motion of the state and pursuant to negotiations, court ordered count 2 dismissed and read-in for sentencing.
.
Sentencing continued....
.
As to count 1:
  Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.   Additional Statement by:  Rebekah S.
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 9 months in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day served. 
 Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for 18 months with the following conditions:
- Serve 60 days in the House of Correction; 40 days STAYED pending review.  The remaining 20 days are to be served now, huber release for work.  Defendant has until 10/15/2015 to report in.
- Complete batterer's intervention program.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- Obtain/maintain employment.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges, including DNA surcharge and restitution if ordered, bail on deposit, if any, to apply; remainder to be paid during the period of probation or a civil judgment will be issued.
- Pay supervision fees.

 
Received and filed: 
Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.
The next court date is in Branch 36.
  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for December 18, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Roy C Viveros in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Sarah McNutt appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Parties are requesting a plea and sentencing date in Branch 36.
  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 8, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.
District Attorney did not order the NO CONTACT ORDER.
Court ordered no possession or use of any dangerous weapons or firearms.
Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Defendant Roy C Viveros in court with attorney Matthew Russell Meyer.  Norman Anthony Gahn appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kremers, Branch 36.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to Defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Branch 36.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for September 2, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
